learning_objective: Discuss issues of bias and accessibility in the design of existing technologies.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex loves playing a popular online multiplayer game and is very good at it. They dream of making it big in the esports industry. However, being the only hearing-impaired player in their gaming community poses some challenges. The high-paced game relies heavily on audio cues for competitiveness. Which of the following statements highlights the issue of bias and accessibility in this scenario?",
    "Answer1": "The esports industry primarily rewards players based on their competitive skill, regardless of disability.",
    "Answer2": "Alex, as a hearing-impaired player, will always be at a disadvantage in a game that depends on sound cues.",
    "Answer3": "As an excellent player, Alex's unique strategy and gameplay could serve to inspire other players to adopt a similar playstyle.",
    "Answer4": "Alex's hearing impairment doesn't alter their love for gaming, showing that personal passion surpasses physical obstacles.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "This scenario represents a classic case of bias and accessibility difficulty in game design. Games that rely heavily on regular audio cues may not account for the needs of hearing-impaired players, hence narrowing the scope of inclusivity in the design of the technology."
}
